column2: ALABAMA PERMIT TEST
column4: Alabama
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: sound the horn.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks ahead
column6: Downgrade
column8: Construction zone

column2: 3. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column8: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.

column2: 4. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column6: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.
column8: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.

column2: 5. Only _____ can reduce the alcohol level in the blood.
column4: drinking coffee
column6: taking a cold shower
column8: time

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column6: Stop Sign Ahead
column8: No Right Turn

column2: 7. To enter a gap in traffic while driving on a highway:
column4: check behind, then watch the vehicle ahead.
column6: speed up and let vehicles make way.
column8: watch only the vehicles behind the gap.

column2: 8. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column6: indicate reserved lanes.
column8: indicate HOV lanes.

column2: 9. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 10. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: stay focused on the center line on the road.
column6: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column8: flash your high beams.

column2: 11. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Round
column6: Pentagon
column8: Vertical rectangle

column2: 12. At an intersection without stop or yield signs, you should:
column4: yield to the vehicle to your left.
column6: wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.
column8: yield to the vehicle to your right.

column2: 13. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: slightly increase their speed.
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 14. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 15. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: pass red lights.
column6: exceed the speed limit
column8: All of the above.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing
column6: School zone
column8: School crossing

column2: 17. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 18. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is a good defensive driving technique.
column6: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
column8: can block traffic.

column2: 19. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 20. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column8: watch for children and be ready to stop.

column2: 21. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 22. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: when it's been raining all day.
column6: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
column8: during the first half hour of rain.

column2: 23. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.
column6: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column8: apply the brake firmly and stop.

column2: 24. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column6: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
column8: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.

column2: 25. Driving at excessive speed:
column4: improves your reaction time.
column6: often leads to high-risk decision-making.
column8: does not increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Keep left
column6: Divided highway begins
column8: Lane ends

column2: 27. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: on public roads

column2: 28. When another vehicle is passing you:
column4: stay in your lane and reduce speed.
column6: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.
column8: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.

column2: 29. When passing another vehicle, you should return to your lane if:
column4: you have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
column6: you are at least 25 feet in front of the passed vehicle.
column8: you can see both headlights in the rearview mirror.

column2: 30. Which of the following road surfaces freezes first when wet?
column4: Bridges and overpasses.
column6: Roundabouts.
column8: Tunnels.

column2: 31. When parking downhill:
column4: turn your wheels away from the side of the road.
column6: turn your wheels towards the side of the road.
column8: keep your wheels straight.

column2: 32. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.

column2: 33. Before entering a curve, you should:
column4: pump your brakes several times.
column6: activate your turn signal.
column8: reduce your speed.

column2: 34. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels toward the curb.
column6: leave the wheels straight.
column8: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: Yield sign ahead
column6: Side road entering from the left
column8: Side road

column2: 36. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 37. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Always.
column6: Never.
column8: If traffic conditions require it.

column2: 38. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: following another vehicle.
column6: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column8: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: Pavement ends
column6: Winding road
column8: Double curve ahead

column2: 40. If it safe to do so, you can pass a vehicle ahead when:
column4: you are on a hill or curve.
column6: there is a broken line on your side of the road.
column8: there is a solid line on your side of the road.
